body:
## Expected Behavior

Services to start.

## Actual Behavior

History service panics during startup, apparently while creating a workflow execution.


## Steps to Reproduce the Problem

  1. Running CRDB V20.1.8.1
  1. Start all services.

## Specifications

  - Version: 1.2.1
  - Platform: Ubuntu (running binaries directly; not Docker images)

Using configuration lifted from https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/tree/master/config (`development_postgres.yaml` and empty `dynamicconfig` file).

comments.body:
Tried CRDB 20.2 on my macbook, cannot reproduce the issue with either actual workflow or SQL layer tests.
Can you plz provide more info?

One more question, are you using the Temporal as is, or is there anything changed in go.mod?
specifically
1. github.com/jmoiron/sqlx
2. github.com/go-sql-driver/mysql
3. github.com/lib/pq
4. github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3

the v1.2.1 still use a temporal workaround on sqlx, make sure when using Temporal as dependency, override this
```
// TODO https://github.com/uber/cadence/issues/2863
replace github.com/jmoiron/sqlx v1.2.0 => github.com/longquanzheng/sqlx v0.0.0-20191125235044-053e6130695c
```
ref: https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/blob/v1.2.1/go.mod#L79-L90
Ah-ha! I wasn't aware of the `replace` rule. Adding that fixed things. Thanks!

title: Panic while running with postgres (CRDB 20.1.x)
